result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason R Higgins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay Restitution for K&S Repair $998.90, Hitchin Rail $1,000.00, D. Chronquist $1,900.00 (total of $3,898.90). To be paid in full first.

If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Eligible for Earned Release until after been confined after 4 years.
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration until after been confined after 4 years.
Comply with conditions as stated in 15CF-470.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason R Higgins

defendant.name: Higgins, Jason R
defendant.address: N8375 County Line Rd, c/o SPCC, Oneida, WI 54155

records.addlTxt: Letter from the Defendant dated 08/05/19

Defendant Jason R Higgins appeared by telephone. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Michael Daniel Zell appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 15CF-470, 15CF-472 and 15CF-473. 

9:15 AM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

This is a continuation from a hearing from earlier in the month. 
Last time parties were on the record, there was failure for victim notification.
State has now complied with victim notification statutes. State has not received any response.
The courtroom is empty, there are no victims.

Defendant previously asked for a sentence modification. Court entered an order denying the request for reasons stated.
Defendant did not cite any new factors that were unknown by the Court at time of sentencing. Following the written denial, Defendant refiled and requested again, that sentence be modified from when he'd be eligible for earned release or substance abuse program. At the time, Defendant would have to be confined 4 years and 6 months first before being eligible. This will be March 8th of next year. 

Defendant continues to be confined in the minimum security prison, goes to work every day. 
Defendant owes about $600 in restitution, not including the surcharges. 

State has not received any letters from victims indicating they received any restitution. State has not asked the victims either. 

Court addresses the parties further.
State agrees with the Court's analysis, does not have much more to add.
Defendant addresses the Court further.

BY THE COURT:
Court denies the request, it does not meet the statutory criteria.

Court addresses Defendant further.

9:24 AM Hearing is concluded.
Motion hearing on November 27, 2019 at 09:15 am.

08:42 AM Defendant Jason R Higgins appeared by phone. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Michael Daniel Zell appeared for State of Wisconsin.

Court questions the defendant and reviews the file with regards to letters received by the defendant. 
Defendant is requesting Earned Release earlier than the 4 years earlier.  Defendant is working outside the prison.  Restitution on 15CF473 is all that he has remaining of $1,318.62.
Atty Zell indicates he was not aware of this hearing until this morning.  The case was assigned with Daniel Hess who was the previous prosecutor.  They should have received notice but they have not sent victim notification. 

Court continues this hearing to another date to allow for victims to be notified of the hearing. 
Court questions the defendant further regarding his employment. He has been working off grounds for about 16 months.  There are 57 inmates who work off grounds currently. 
Court questions Atty Zell. 
  Motion hearing scheduled for November 27, 2019 at 09:15 am.
Sentence adjustment review on November 5, 2019 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: for a Motion to Declare Defendant Indigent
Denying Motion Staying Payment of Financial Obligations /s/ TTF 10/25/17

Attorney  Ryan Drengler appeared by phone for Defendant Jason R Higgins #401614. Prosecuting Atty Michael Zell appeared for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard at this time are 15CF-470, 15CF-472, 15CF-473 and 12CF-266.

3:03 PM Court calls case.
Clerk calls Defendant at corrections facility.

Court states appearances.

Defendant wrote a letter that the Court is treating as a motion requesting that the amounts of new monies deposited in prison account not to be taken out, only asking for state wages to be taken out.

Defendant addresses the Court, explains.

Court replies.

Atty Zell addresses the Court, opposes to the motion. DOC is entitled to take anything reasonable. 
State requests motion to be denied.

Court has received briefs from the State as well as opinions from the Atty General's office.
There is a large amount of restitution due and owing still.
DOC has the authority to take all new monies and they can determine what is reasonable.

BY THE COURT:
Motion requesting that a lower amount be ordered than what has been taken out is denied.

Court questions Defendant.
Defendant replies.
MR date is 9/2021, then 6 yrs on extended supervision.
from the defendant dated June 21, 2017
Motion hearing on July 25, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jason R Higgins in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Jason R Higgins in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Probation agent is also present.
Cases heard at this time are 15CF-470, 472, 473 and 12CF-266.

2:22 PM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

Court ordered a new PSI.
One was prepared.
Copies were forwarded to counsel.
Atty Constable states she has two corrections to address, for the record.
Atty Constable requests that bailiff to retrieve 12CF-266.

State has complied with victim notification statutes with regards to the 15CF cases.
Victims are present but they do not wish to make a statement.
Court thanks victims for being here.

Atty Drengler reviewed the PSI with his client.
Atty Drengler states he has one correction to address, for the record.

Neither party have witnesses.

2:30 PM 12CF-266 will be addressed first - Original Court File is handed to Atty Constable to review the SAR packet and the file.
State is prepared to proceed with the SAR hearing.

12CF-266:
Atty Constable addresses the Court, makes recommendations as stated on the record. 
Court questions Atty Constable regarding victim notification. State is unsure if victim was given notification. 
DA's file is in the courtroom now.  
State addresses the Court, cannot proceed with this case because victim was not given notification and wished to receive notifications. 

BY THE COURT:
Court cannot proceed to sentencing in this case today.

Court will proceed with 15CF cases. 

Court reviews the charges in the 15CF files.

State addresses the Court, makes recommendations, for the record.
Atty Drengler addresses the Court, makes recommendations, for the record.

Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Parties address bond - Atty Drengler states a $50,000 signature bond was ordered. Atty Constable concurs.
Minutes in the files indicate $50,000 cash bond.  Atty Constable will request a transcript from the court reporter to verify, in order to determine sentence credit.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CF-470:
Ct 1:
Determinate Prison Sentence for 6 years
Initial Confinement 3 years
Extended Supervision 3 years
Eligible for Earned Release until after been confined after 4 years
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration until after been confined after 4 years
Conditions:
No contact with Christopher Philipp
No contact with or be on the premises of : Feltz Manufacturing, R&J Auto Sports, Service Transport, Town of Linwood Town Hall/Garage, Town of Carson Town Hall, Altenburg Dairy, Taylored Stone, Cintas, Deborah Chronquist, Hitchin Rail, K&S Auto Repair, Maher Water, Paragon Specialties, and Roger Flees. 
Do not engage in pawning, scrapping, and other similar activities, unless preapproved by agent
Complete and AODA assessment if not receive treatment at prison, and follow all treatment recommendation for drug addiction 
Maintain absolute sobriety
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances
All prescriptions from one pharmacy
Sign release of information forms for offenders assessments, medications/pharmacies and/or treatment
Comply with other assessments, treatment and programming as deemed appropriate by the Compas assessment and the DOC
Provide DNA for testing if not already done so
Pay Restitution Joint and Several with co-defendant, in the amount of $12,626.63 - parties are listed on page 28 of PSI
Town of Carson: $3,903.44; R&J Auto Sport, LLC: $349; Linwood Town Garage: $1,300; Paragon Specialties: $1,250; Service Transportation: $4,565.19; Cintas: $1,089 and Altenburg Dairy: $170.
Pay Restitution of $2,898.90
K&S Repair LLC: $998.90; Hitchin Rain: $1,000 and Deborah Chronquist: $1,900.
K&S Repair LLC, Hithcin Rail, Deborah Chronquist and Altenburg Dairy are to be paid first.
25% of all monies from prison account are to be paid to restitution. Balance to be paid during extended supervision
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

10:38 am. Court calls case.

15CF472 Cts 1 & 2: NO CONTEST
15CF473 Cts 5, 10, 12 & 14: NO CONTEST

Court informs defendant of Constitutional Rights
Court advises defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge

Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made & finds freely & voluntarily waived rights

Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s)
All victims have been given notifications and there are some here today.
States accepts said stipulation
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s)
